alert.note: Alert for Weber (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 01 at 9:44PM MDT until May 06 at 6:12PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Utah... The Lower Weber River At Plain City affecting Weber County. .Warm temperatures will melt snowpack and increase river flows. For the Weber River...including Plain City...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...The Lower Weber River At Plain City. * WHEN...Until Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...At 27.0 feet, flooding will occur along the levee system near Plain City, affecting local farmland adjacent to the Weber River. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 PM MDT Monday the stage was 25.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage Tuesday afternoon, then oscillate around flood stage through Friday night with a maximum value of 27.3 feet, or 4700 CFS, expected Wednesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 27.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Even 6 inches of fast-moving flood water can knock you off your feet and a depth of 2 feet will float your car. Never try to walk, swim, or drive through such swift water. If you come upon flood waters, stop, turn around and go another way. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by Tuesday at Noon MDT.
